name: BEST WESTERN Aramis Saint Germain

reviews.text: I was leery of a Best Western franchise in Paris - it just didn't seem right - but I had heard nothing but positives about BW in France. I have to say, it was great. Hotels in Paris are so expensive that my daughter and I just wanted something clean, comfortable and in a great area. This is the 6th arrond., very close to 2 metro stops, many wonderful restaurants and within easy walking distance of many Paris attractions. The street noise at night can get pretty loud, as it's a very active area, but we closed the windows and put on the AC and it was very peaceful. The bathrooms were clean and modern, the staff was very, very helpful and friendly. Rooms are small by US standards but all we wanted was a place to sleep and a good bathroom. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to the budget traveler.
reviews.title: A great value in a wonderful location
It is good hotel "if you are solo traveler"!
reviews.text: I have read the reviews and saw the pictures of this hotel, so i decided to book there for its good location, I payed about 100 euros or more per night thru booking.com.
the location is good and there is alot of coffee shops and resturant and two or three metro station, the stuff of the reception are friendly especially the oldest one (sorry i don't know his name :)
reviews.title: Very nice stay - great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: In addition, the rooms are way too small, even though I'm petite. To the point where my foot randomly hits the table leg or the bed while I'm walking (not joking)
reviews.title: Great location, Exceptional staff

reviews.text: xD
reviews.title: So glad we chose Hotel Aramis!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location in Saint Germain, near Metro (subway), "brasseries", "boulangeries" and "patisseries". Rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. Staff are super friendly.
reviews.title: A really nice experience in Paris

reviews.text: Greatest advantage of this hotel is it's location. The Notre Dame is a 15 min walk, there are a lot of shops and cafes around, and the metro station is right across the street. At night it's quiet and the rooms are small but clean. I also found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Cozy hotel with a great location

reviews.text: Family group of 5 with ages ranging from 12 to 77 spent three nights in the hotel. From the onset staff took excellent care when a misunderstanding occurred with the reservation. Courteous desk staff including assistant manager William were more than willing to assist at all times. Hotel locale offered excellent shopping and dining opportunities. Also, subway and bus lines available just steps from the hotel lobby. Rooms clean, air conditioned, and quiet in the center of the bustling neighborhood. Will definitely return!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with great service, location, and comfortable rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. Location so near to St. Placide Metro station is super convenient. Rennes station is also nearby. We stayed 5 nights. We had a room for 3 -- husband/wife/college student - double bed and singel bed. We were delighted to find a room for 3 since we did not want to pay for 2 rooms. However, this room was very small, it looked like a small double with another bed added. Since we only used the room for sleeping this worked ok for us. Bedrooom was clean. Nice bedding and comfortable beds. Bathroom had tub with shower and was clean. Room was quiet at night if you kept the windows shut. Since they have air conditioning this was not a problem. Free wi fi internet was great. We were on 5th floor and it worked fine.
reviews.title: Very Convenient Location

reviews.text: Like most Paris hotels the rooms are very small, comfortable beds and very well located. .Bus 95 stops directly in front of the hotel to reach most popular tourist sights within minutes. Next door and across the street are great bistros for lunch and dinner. Also across the street is a bakery where we had breakfast every morning, the American coffee was very good. We always bought one of their small baquettes to munch on throughout the day, delicious. The hotel has breakfast for 13 Euros, cannot make any comment on this as we did not have breakfast there. We choose a guided tour of Verseille for 91 euros, a ripoff. Try to buy your tickets in advance to avoid the ticket line and go on your on using their video system.
reviews.title: Small but well located.

reviews.text: The hotel is in a central location, very close to the station and only a short walk to bus stops. The front desk is proficient with English speakers who were very helpful. The room was on the small side but did the job. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family.
reviews.title: Nice hotel; enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: On arrival at the hotel we were a little unsure about the road noise we would experience as we were on a busy main road with two bus stops outside and opposite the hotel, and the metro station on the other side of the crossing. We checked in and were warmly welcomed by the staff who spoke fluent english and who went out of their way to help us. We were given a map of the area with the hotel marked on and the bus and metro routes to get to all the main attractions in Paris. We went up to our room, which was usual French size but perfectly big enough when your spending the days out walking the sites of Paris. The room was clean, the ensuite large and fully equipped, and there was NO traffic noise what so ever, we were really impressed. The temperatures were very high the week we were there, 38 centigrade most days but the effective air conditioning meant we always came back to a cool room. It was a thorougly good trip and the staff and hotel made it even more enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel if you want somewhere clean, friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel is located close to the Gare Montparnasse- 5-10 minutes away and 3 Metro stops- across the street, and 2 a few blocks away. There is a ATM across the street and 2 more within a few blocks away. Rue St. Germain was a 10 minute walk- where Cafe Flore, Magots and a third famous cafe are. Monoprix was also up the street about 10 min away. There are a ton of cafes/brasseries around for breakfast in the morning. Seems that once we walked up to St. Germain, there were so many more choices. The front desk also has great suggestions of where to go for dinner/meals too. The hotel info binder in the room also had a little sheet on which metro to take to the main attractions.
reviews.title: clean, friendly and helpful, AIR-CONDITIONING!

reviews.text: Although we did not take any tours, the front desk was very helpful to those looking for them. We like to walk to the attractions so the location of the hotel seemed perfect for us. and the air conditioning was terrific. This made up for a small room. Not complaining about the room, just realize that it is small.
reviews.title: Nice friendly hotel

reviews.text: Our room was small but very clean. There's no traffic noise as it's been fully sound insulated. It's a little too far south for the main areas but the Metro is very handly (50m). Plenty of Bistros around and a good fixed price restaurant we found called the L'Epi Dupin just 5 minutes away (book days ahead as they get fully booked)
reviews.title: would return to the Aramis
Good Value
reviews.text: Stayed here in July 2005 for only 81euros per night. Given that, it was a good deal, but it wasn't perfect. Room was very small, and I could hear other guests more than I would have liked. Furnishings were adequate. Air conditioning worked well. Liked the location across the street from a Metro stop. In summary, it's nice if you're trying to save a few Euros, but it's nothing exceptional.

We stayed for 5 nights at the Aramis and have to say, upon arrival, when we saw our room, we thought we might have to sleep standing up!!! - It was no bigger than a closet. Now, I have visited Paris many times, and am aware that the rooms are small but this was a little tooooo small. We then asked to change our room, and the next morning we were changed to a larger room (same price), which was very comfortable. The rooms were clean but not as nice as they look in the photos the hotel has. It was average. Also, it's not really Saint Germain, its about two blocks from Montparnasse tower, and about five to St Germain . . . and Rue de Rennes is a very busy street. People were very nice and helpful. Overall a good deal for Paris, but there were plenty of hotels closer to St. Germain that I saw that looked nicer. the Lutetia is one that looked really nice.
reviews.title: Comfortable but. . . .

reviews.text: Nevertheless - this location (Montparnasse/St. Germain) is really the best location. . . and honestly . . we didnt spend much time in the room!
reviews.title: Great location, Excellent for the price

reviews.text: We were looking for a hotel with some Paris charm, but that also had all the conveniences you would want such as Air-Con and a good bathroom.
reviews.title: Suited us just fine

reviews.text: We picked this hotel from the 1000's of Paris Hotels and were very happy with it. It was a reasonable price (for Paris!) and was well located with 2 Metro stops right near by. We also were keen to get a non-smoking room (as many don't offer this).
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: There's also a great patisserie, combined with (of all things) a Chinese restaurant (more cafe style really) across the road. We'd recommend you have breakfast there, and at least once have the Chinese as both were excellent. There is also a late night deli (small market) next to that for any late night supplies you might need which came in handy for us.
reviews.title: Cozy but nice
Good sized room
reviews.text: The staff were helpful and we'd happy recommend this hotel to our friends if staying in Paris.
I needed to choose a hotel and had no idea where to start. Because of Trip Advisor, I came across this hotel. The worst that was said was that the rooms were small. I knew I could live with "small".
reviews.title: Small and cozy but very nice
Great little hotel
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in late July. Great staff and location, though probably closer to Montparnasse than St Germain. Ok , the rooms are on the small side , but they are fully air conditioned and have tea/coffee making facilities, which is fairly rare for European hotels of this category.There are also plenty of cafes and bars in the immediate vicinity and St Placide metro stop is literally right accross the street. Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last year I stayed here with my teenage daughter and we so loved it that I booked it again for a 20th anniversary trip with my husband. I emailed the hotel ahead of time, letting them know that it was a special trip and they didn't disappoint: we were given a lovely, quiet room on an upper floor. Although the rooms here are small compared to American standards, they are beautifully appointed with very comfy beds and plenty of amenities. The breakfast is a little pricey, but they give you so much that we ended up skipping lunch and just grabbing a snack mid-afternoon, which ultimately saved money. But if you prefer a smaller, less expensive breakfast, the cafe next door is great.
reviews.title: charming little hotel in a great location

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located for just about anything on the Left Bank -- 20 minute walk to Musee d'Orsay and the Metro line is right out front. Another line is two blocks away and the bus that goes straight to the Louvre stops across the street. We love to stroll city streets and this area is great for that: cute shops, fabulous cafes, lots of street life. Jardin de Luxembourg is a 10 minute walk as is the area around Blvd. St. Germain which is bustling at all hours; wonderful to stroll around after dinner. (Americans sometimes forget how much farther north Paris is; it's on the same latitude as Newfoundland, so in the summer it doesn't get dark until nearly 11 pm.) Also, two days each week there is an outdoor "farmer's market" two blocks away on Blvd. Raspail; in addition to foodstuffs (produce, cheeses, meat, fish, etc) there are vendors selling clothing, jewelry and gourmet products -- a great place to get inexpensive souvenirs and gifts.
reviews.title: Won't be my last stay at the Aramis!

reviews.text: All in all, Hotel Aramis combines a great location with comfortable rooms and great service. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: I really love the Aramis - predictable quality in a real Parisian neighborhood

reviews.text: I went to Paris as a solo traveler and the Aramis was my first introduction to the city. It was extremely easy to get to from CDG airport on the metro. Location was FABULOUS - bus stop right outside and metro station just steps away. I traveled all over Paris for a few days with the Aramis as my base. It's on a busy street but wasn't noisy. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room and bathroom were both extremely small, but this is to be expected of Paris hotels in this price range. My room had air conditioning and the hotel has wifi, both big pluses for me. I'm not a picky traveler and I spent almost no time in my room anyway, so the fact that it was small didn't bother me. Both Faisal and Francine at the front desk were so friendly and extremely helpful too, they helped me plan my travels around Paris and told me about some off-the-beaten-path places that I thoroughly enjoyed. Would definitely stay at the Aramis again if I'm fortunate to find myself in Paris again in the future!
reviews.title: Great stay in Paris...again
Loved the hotel.
reviews.text: I had not been to Paris in over 20 years and did not know what to expect. Loved the Hotel, rooms are clean but very very small. Staff was very helpful in directions and places to eat. Very central location to shops (Bon Marche) buses and the Metro I would stay there again and give it a 4 star rating.

reviews.title: It does the job, simple as that.
reviews.text: I've been to Paris on many occasions for the past 5 years, and tried various hotels ranging from 3 - 5 star establishments. I've never stayed on the other side of the river though, so took the plunge (pardon the pun), read the above average reviews on this website regarding Aramis SG and booked 3 nights including breakfast for 300 Euros.

Now if you're looking for grandeur and plush surroundings, with a chocolate of your pillow at night, then this place is not for you and you better get you wallet out and pay a minimum of an extra £100/night for that.
reviews.title: Very small room
A nice stay overall
reviews.text: However this is the best 3 star I've stayed at while in Paris, as it's very clean, the rooms are nicely decorated, there's a comfortable bed, a decent size bathroom (with the obligatory free shampoo, soap, etc) and 3 English speaking channels on the TV (BBC, SKY and CNN).

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: The reception staff were fantastic, spoke excellent English when my French faltered, suggested good places to eat, and sorted out a few matters for me while I was over there. I agree with other reviewers in that if you have to pay for your breakfast, it might not be worth the 12 Euros, but as it was included I found it very adequate. Every morning I had my hot chocolate, freshly squeezed orange juice, a fruit salad, a baguette, bun and croissant with various spreads, all served with a smile in the bar/lounge area. Try it the first day, if you don't think it's worth it, there's plenty other choices available on the street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location with 2 Metro Stations within 200 metres. A variety of eating places within 500 metres. Very helpful staff. Clean well appointed rooms if a little small but certainly big enough for my wife and I.
reviews.title: Aramis. Easy access to all the sights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights. Hotel is in excellent location, midway between Gare Montparness and blvd St. Germain.
reviews.title: good location, nice hotel, small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a Metro station right outside the hotel and another one 250 meters away. Also bus station very close by.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: Rue de Rennes is packed with bistros, cafes, bakery and shops.
reviews.title: Not the worst, certainly not the best

reviews.text: Hotel itself is nice, clean. Staff very helpful and speaks English well.
reviews.title: Good location, but room sizes are for malnourished people

aka: Best Western Aramis Saint Germain Hotel Paris
description: Saint-germain,montparnasse. the unique atmosphere of the left bank will charm you with its antique shops, its art galleries and its designer stores…without forgetting its museums, its famous cafes and restaurants…what a delight to stroll in its colourful, narrow streets.It’s here where the aramis hotel welcomes you with a smile, and offers you charm, well-earned relaxation, and modern confort.In the heart of paris, left bank, the Aramis hotel goes for seduction.
